references.reason: This paper is foundational to the field of diffusion models and provides the theoretical underpinnings for the methods used in the current work.
This paper introduces DDIM, a more efficient and deterministic sampling method for diffusion models that is crucial for practical applications.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces Stable Diffusion, a highly influential model used as the basis for many subsequent advancements in text-to-image generation.

references.paper_title: Self-play fine-tuning converts weak language models to strong language models
references.reason: This paper introduces the SPIN framework which the authors adapt for diffusion models, providing a novel self-play fine-tuning approach.

references.paper_title: Pick-a-pic: An open dataset of user preferences for text-to-image generation
references.reason: This paper introduces a dataset that is used for evaluating the models' alignment with human preferences, providing empirical validation for the claims made in the current work.
